title:
Use cosinor regression to estimate the phase shift induced by a stimulus
during a circadian time-course. — tipaCosinor
text: time Vector time values full time-course. y Vector measurements (e.g., bioluminescence) full time-course. stimOnset Time stimulus started. stimDuration Duration stimulus transients. Data stimOnset stimOnset + stimDuration ignored. periodGuess Approximate period oscillations (units used time), used initial value fitting sine curves. trend Model long-term trend cosinor fit epoch. Uses natural cubic spline 4 degrees freedom. strongly recommended keep TRUE. set FALSE, function may give error give completely invalid results. shortcut Calculate phase shift using standard TIPA procedure using shortcut based phases sine curve fits. two methods give exactly result.

title:
Use cosinor regression to estimate the phase shift induced by a stimulus
during a circadian time-course. — tipaCosinor
text: list. phaseShift Estimated phase shift circadian hours. Negative values correspond delay, positive values advance. epochInfo Dataframe containing information sine curve fits epoch: period (units used time), phase (radians), root mean square error (units y). RMS errors pre-stimulus post-stimulus substantially different, stimulus may induced change waveform thus phase shift estimates may invalid.

title:
Use cosinor regression to estimate the phase shift induced by a stimulus
during a circadian time-course. — tipaCosinor
code: # Time-course data from multiple (simulated) experiments getTimecourseFile = function() {   system.file('extdata', 'timecourses.csv', package = 'tipa')} df = read.csv(getTimecourseFile(), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  resultList = lapply(sort(unique(df$expId)), function(ii) {   time = df$time[df$expId == ii]   y = df$intensity[df$expId == ii]   tipaCosinor(time, y, stimOnset = 0)})  phaseShifts = sapply(resultList, function(r) r$phaseShift)

title:
Use phase reference points to estimate the phase shift induced by a stimulus

code: # Peak times of bioluminescence (in hours) phaseRefTimes = c(-75.5, -51.5, -27.4, -3.8,                   20.5, 42.4, 65.5, 88.0) result = tipaPhaseRef(phaseRefTimes, stimOnset = 0)  # Data from multiple (simulated) experiments getExtrFile = function() {   system.file('extdata', 'phaseRefTimes.csv', package = 'tipa')} getStimFile = function() {   system.file('extdata', 'stimOnsets.csv', package = 'tipa')}  extrDf = read.csv(getExtrFile(), stringsAsFactors = FALSE) stimDf = read.csv(getStimFile(), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  resultList = lapply(stimDf$expId, function(ii) {   phaseRefTimes = extrDf$phaseRefTime[extrDf$expId == ii]   stimOnset = stimDf$stimOnset[stimDf$expId == ii]   tipaPhaseRef(phaseRefTimes, stimOnset)})  phaseShifts = sapply(resultList, function(r) r$phaseShift)
